meanings.definition: A large number of fish swimming together.
meanings.sent1: The shools of fish in the ocean create a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: I saw a shools of fish while snorkeling in the reef.
meanings.sent3: The shools of fish seemed to be having a party in the water.
meanings.sent4: The shools of fish moved like a shimmering ribbon in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The shools of fish danced gracefully in the water.

meanings.definition: To move or swim in a group.
meanings.sent1: The fish shools together for safety.
meanings.sent2: We shools across the lake to reach the other side.
meanings.sent3: The children shools happily in the pool during swimming lessons.
meanings.sent4: The birds shools through the sky in perfect formation.
meanings.sent5: The students shools to the cafeteria for lunch every day.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things moving together.
meanings.sent1: The shools of tourists followed the guide through the museum.
meanings.sent2: A shools of ants marched in a straight line across the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The shools of clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent4: The shools of cars in rush hour traffic seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The shools of students poured out of the school after the final bell.
